yafs¶

The yafs module is the main component who perform the simulation.

The following tables list all of the available components in this module.

Core¶

Sim(topology[, name_register, …]) This class contains the cloud event-discrete simulation environment and it controls the structure variables.

Topology¶

Topology([logger]) This class unifies the functions to deal with Complex Networks as a network topology within of the simulator.

Application¶

Application(name) An application is defined by a DAG between modules that generate, compute and receive messages.
Message(name, src, dst[, instructions, …]) A message is set by the following values:

Population¶

Population(name[, activation_dist, logger]) A population algorithm controls how the message generation of the sensor modules is associated in the nodes of the topology.
Statical(name[, activation_dist, logger]) This implementation of a population algorithm statically assigns the generation of a source in a node of the topology.

Placement¶

Placement(name[, activation_dist, logger]) A placement (or allocation) algorithm controls where to locate the service modules and their replicas in the different nodes of the topology, according to load criteria, or other objectives.
ClusterPlacement(name[, activation_dist, logger]) This implementation locates the services of the application in the cheapest cluster regardless of where the sources or sinks are located.

Selection¶

Selection([logger]) A selection algorithm provide the route among topology entities for that a message reach the destiny module.
OneRandomPath([logger]) Among all the possible options, it returns a random path.
First_ShortestPath([logger]) Among all possible shorter paths, returns the first.

Metrics¶

Metrics([default_results_path])

Distribution¶

Distribution(name) Abstract class
deterministic_distribution(time, **kwargs)
exponential_distribution(lambd[, seed])
class yafs.Sim(topology, name_register='events_log.json', link_register='links_log.json', redis=None, purge_register=True, logger=None, default_results_path=None)[source]¶

This class contains the cloud event-discrete simulation environment and it controls the structure variables.

Args:
topology (object) - the associate (Topology) of the environment. There is only one.
Kwargs:

name_register (str): database file name where are registered the events.

purge_register (boolean): True - clean the database

logger (logger) - logger

Main variables to coordinate with algorithm:

deploy_app(app, placement, population, selector)[source]¶

This process is responsible for linking the application to the different algorithms (placement, population, and service)

Args:

app (object): Application class

placement (object): Placement class

population (object): Population class

selector (object): Selector class

deploy_monitor(name, function, distribution, **param)[source]¶

Add a DES process for user purpose

Args:

name (string) name of monitor

function (function): function that will be invoked within the simulator with the user’s code

distribution (function): a temporary distribution function

Kwargs:
param (dict): the parameters of the distribution function
deploy_sink(app_name, node, module)[source]¶

Add a DES process for deploy pure SINK modules (actuators) This function its used by (Placement): algorithm Internatlly, there is not a DES PROCESS for this type of behaviour

Args:

app_name (str): application name

node (int): entity.id of the topology who will create the messages

module (str): module

deploy_source(app_name, id_node, msg, distribution)[source]¶

Add a DES process for deploy pure source modules (sensors) This function its used by (Population) algorithm

Args:

app_name (str): application name

id_node (int): entity.id of the topology who will create the messages

distribution (function): a temporary distribution function

Kwargs:
param - the parameters of the distribution function
Returns:
id (int) the same input id

run(until, test_initial_deploy=False, show_progress_monitor=True, mobile_behaviour=False)[source]¶

Start the simulation

Args:
until (int): Defines a stop time. If None the simulation runs until some internal algorithm changes the var yafs.core.sim.stop to True

set_movement_control(evol)[source]¶
start_process(id)[source]¶

All pure source modules (sensors) are controlled by this boolean. Using this function (Population) algorithm can start one source

Args:
id.source (int): the identifier of the DES process.
stop_process(id)[source]¶

All pure source modules (sensors) are controlled by this boolean. Using this function (Population) algorithm can stop one source

Args:
id.source (int): the identifier of the DES process.
undeploy_module(app_name, service_name, idtopo)[source]¶

removes all modules deployed in a node modules with the same name = service_name from app_name deployed in id_topo

class yafs.Topology(logger=None)[source]¶

This class unifies the functions to deal with Complex Networks as a network topology within of the simulator. In addition, it facilitates its creation, and assignment of attributes.

LINK_BW = 'BW'¶
LINK_PR = 'PR'¶
NODE_IPT = 'IPT'¶

Add a list of nodes in the topology

Args:

nodes (list): a list of identifiers

edges (list): a list of destination edges

find_IDs(value)[source]¶

Search for nodes with the same attributes that value

Args:
value (dict). example value = {“model”: “m-“}. Only one key is admitted
Returns:
A list with the ID of each node that have the same attribute that the value.value

class yafs.Application(name)[source]¶

An application is defined by a DAG between modules that generate, compute and receive messages.

Args:
name (str): The name must be unique within the same topology.
Returns:
an application
TYPE_MODULE = 'MODULE'¶
TYPE_SINK = 'SINK'¶
TYPE_SOURCE = 'SOURCE'¶
add_service_module(module_name, message_in, message_out='', distribution='', module_dest=[], p=[], **param)[source]¶

Link to each non-pure module a management of transfering of messages

Args:

module_name (str): module name

message_in (Message): input message

message_out (Message): output message. If Empty the module is a sink

distribution (function): a function with a distribution function

module_dest (list): a list of modules who can receive this message. Broadcasting.

p (list): a list of probabilities to send this message. Broadcasting

Kwargs:
param (dict): the parameters for distribution function
add_service_source(module_name, distribution=None, message=None, module_dest=[], p=[])[source]¶

Link to each non-pure module a management for creating messages

Args:

module_name (str): module name

distribution (function): a function with a distribution function

message (Message): the message

module_dest (list): a list of modules who can receive this message. Broadcasting.

p (list): a list of probabilities to send this message. Broadcasting

Kwargs:
param_distribution (dict): the parameters for distribution function
add_source_messages(msg)[source]¶

Add in the application those messages that come from pure sources (sensors). This distinction allows them to be controlled by the (Population) algorithm

get_message(name)[source]¶

Returns: a message instance from the identifier name

get_pure_modules()[source]¶
Returns:
a list of pure source and sink modules
get_sink_modules()[source]¶
Returns:
a list of sink modules
set_modules(data)[source]¶

Pure source or sink modules must be typified

Args:
data (dict) : a set of characteristic of modules
class yafs.Message(name, src, dst, instructions=0, bytes=0, broadcasting=False)[source]¶

A message is set by the following values:

Args:

name (str): a name, unique for each application

src (str): the name of module who send this message

dst (dst): the nsame of module who recibe this message

inst (int): the number of instrucctions to be executed ((by default 0), Instead of MIPS, we use IPt since the time is relative to the simulation units.

bytes (int): the size in bytes (by default 0)

Internal args used in the yafs.core are:

timestamp (float): simulation time. Instant of time that was created.

path (list): a list of entities of the topology that has to travel to reach its target module from its source module.

dst_int (int): an identifier of the intermediate entity in which it is in the process of transmission.

app_name (str): the name of the application

class yafs.Population(name, activation_dist=None, logger=None)[source]¶

A population algorithm controls how the message generation of the sensor modules is associated in the nodes of the topology. This assignment is based on a generation controller to each message. And a generation control is assigned to a node or to several in the topology both during the initiation and / or during the execution of the simulation.

Note

A class interface

Args:

name (str): associated name

activation_dist (function): a distribution function to active the run function in execution time

Kwargs:
param (dict): the parameters of the activation_dist
get_next_activation()[source]¶
Returns:
the next time to be activated in the simulation
initial_allocation(sim, app_name)[source]¶

Given an ecosystem and an application, it starts the allocation of pure sources in the topology.

Attention

override required

run(sim)[source]¶

This method will be invoked during the simulation to change the assignment of the modules that generate the messages.

Args:
sim (:mod: yafs.core.Sim)
set_sink_control(values)[source]¶

localization of sink modules

set_src_control(values)[source]¶

Stores the drivers of each message generator.

Args:
values (dict):
class yafs.Statical(name, activation_dist=None, logger=None)[source]¶

This implementation of a population algorithm statically assigns the generation of a source in a node of the topology. It is only invoked in the initialization.

Extends: :mod: Population

get_next_activation()¶
Returns:
the next time to be activated in the simulation

A placement (or allocation) algorithm controls where to locate the service modules and their replicas in the different nodes of the topology, according to load criteria, or other objectives.

Kwargs:

scaleService(scale)[source]¶
class yafs.ClusterPlacement(name, activation_dist=None, logger=None)[source]¶

This implementation locates the services of the application in the cheapest cluster regardless of where the sources or sinks are located.

It only runs once, in the initialization.

the next time to be activated

class yafs.Selection(logger=None)[source]¶

A selection algorithm provide the route among topology entities for that a message reach the destiny module.

Note

A class interface

get_path(sim, app_name, message, topology_src, alloc_DES, alloc_module, traffic, from_des)[source]¶

Args:

Parameters:
  • sim –
  • message –
  • link –
  • alloc_DES –
  • alloc_module –
  • traffic –
  • ctime –

:param from_des :return:

both empty arrays implies that the message will not send to the destination.

Returns:

a path among nodes

an identifier of the module

Attention

override required

get_path_from_failure(sim, message, link, alloc_DES, alloc_module, traffic, ctime, from_des)[source]¶

This function is call when some link of a message path is broken or unavailable. A new one from that point should be calculated.

Parameters:
  • sim –
  • message –
  • link –
  • alloc_DES –
  • alloc_module –
  • traffic –
  • ctime –

:param from_des :return:

both empty arrays implies that the message will not send to the destination.

Attention

this function is optional
